intro: Psychotria jasminiflora, commonly known as the jasmine psychotria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that emit a jasmine-like scent, which is a distinguishing feature. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a waxy texture. Psychotria jasminiflora is part of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants.
